entries.title: ‘Enough!’: Pope Francis demands end to conflict in South Sudan
entries.description: “No more destruction, it's time to build,” the pope told President Salva Kiir and assembled dignitaries. “Leave the time of war behind and let a time of peace dawn.”

entries.title: The U.S. could knock the Chinese balloon out the sky, but it's risky
entries.description: Some politicians are demanding that the Pentagon shoot down the Chinese balloon that has invaded America's skies, but security experts told NBC News on Friday that's easier said than done.

entries.title: Suspected Chinese spy balloon unlikely to be shot down over fears of collateral damage
entries.description: The Pentagon said Friday it does not plan to shoot down a suspected Chinese spy balloon floating 60,000 feet above the U.S.

entries.title: ‘Your future is with us’: E.U. bosses move towards Ukrainian membership
entries.description: “Ukraine is the E.U., the E.U. is Ukraine. Let's make it happen,” said European Council President Charles Michel in a Kyiv press conference with President Zelenskyy. “Slava Ukraini. Vive l'Europe,” he concluded.

entries.title: Pope's message of peace and reconciliation inspires people in Congo
entries.description: KINSHASA, Congo — They came away enthused by Pope Francis' message of peace and reconciliation and said they were hoping Congo's leaders would take heed.

entries.title: Former pop star Gary Glitter released from U.K. prison halfway through sentence for sexual abuse
entries.description: Former pop star Gary Glitter was released from prison in England on Friday after serving half of a 16-year prison sentence for sexually abusing three young girls in the 1970s.

entries.title: Indian gay couples begin legal battle for same-sex marriage
entries.description: Utkarsh Saxena and Ananya Kotia’s love story began just like any other college romance.

entries.title: Republicans blast Biden, saying suspected Chinese spy balloon proves U.S. isn't deterring Xi
entries.description: Top Republicans in Congress are criticizing the Biden administration's response to the suspected Chinese surveillance balloon hovering over the U.S.

entries.title: Suspected spy balloon complicates Blinken’s high-stakes China trip
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s bid to slow the downward spiral in relations between the U.S. and China has been complicated further by news of a suspected Chinese spy balloon hovering over the United States.

entries.title: Ukraine using surveillance drones to monitor Belarus border
entries.description: Amid concern that Russia may be preparing another onslaught around the anniversary of its Feb. 24 invasion, the Ukrainian army is operating surveillance drones along the border with Belarus.

entries.title: Today, military hardware is decisive on Ukraine's battlefields. Tomorrow, elections may be a deciding factor.
entries.description: In 2024, the future of the war in Ukraine may be decided elsewhere: by votes not just in the United States but in Russia, too.

entries.title: Mafia hitman found working as pizza chef in France after 16 years on the run
entries.description: Mafia hitman Edgardo Greco, who has links to Italy's notorious ‘ndranghetha crime group, was arrested Thursday in France, where he had been working as a pizza chef.

entries.title: Pope Francis leaves Congo headed to South Sudan
entries.description: Pope Francis wrapped up his visit to Democratic Republic of Congo and headed to neighboring South Sudan.

entries.title: Watch: Eyewitness video captures object in the sky over Billings, Montana
entries.description: Chase Doak took video of an object in the sky Billings, Montana, on the same day a suspected spy balloon passed over the area, according to the Pentagon.

entries.title: China says it’s looking into suspected spy balloon over U.S.; Canada monitoring ‘potential second incident’
entries.description: China urged calm Friday and said that it was looking into reports of a high-altitude surveillance balloon suspected of belonging to Beijing hovering over the United States, while Canada said it was monitoring a “potential second incident.”

entries.title: China is 'looking into' suspected spy balloon over U.S.
entries.description: Spokesperson of China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs Mao Ning said at a daily briefing on Friday that Beijing is still verifying reports that a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon was spotted over U.S. airspace.

entries.title: Russia strikes Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk in deadly missile attack
entries.description: Russia launched deadly missile strikes targeting the eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk, killing at least three people, according to Ukraine. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez has more details on the ongoing conflict.

entries.title: Suspected Chinese spy balloon found hovering over northern U.S.: NBC News Exclusive
entries.description: The government has been monitoring a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon that has been hovering over the northern U.S. for the past few days, according to two U.S. officials and a senior defense official. NBC News’ Courtney Kube has more details.
